revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=SRCT |model=N03 |revision= |fcc_date=10/15/2012 |is_manuf=No |availability= |type=media player |fcc_id=PZN-N03 |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Amlogic |cpu1_model=AML8726 |cpu1_cspeed=800 |fla1=256 |fla1_brand=Micron |fla1_model= |ram1=1 GiB |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model= |ram1_num=4 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, SD Card |expansion_usb_num=2 |serial= |jtag= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8188CUS |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=HDMI |tp_firmware=Android |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }}
*"N03 VER 2.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The models covered by this FCC ID are apparently the N02, M03, N04, N05, and N06. :It is not readily apparent what the differences between models are (if any).
While the CPU is obscured by thermal adhesive (or paste/something else), :it is clearly identifiable as an ''[[Amlogic]]'' chip from the small bits :of the logo and part number that is visible.
*The NAND flash appears to be a ''Micron'' MT29F32G... (2Gbit / 256MB).
The manufacturer (/ distributor ) of this device is (apparently) :''Shenzhen Risun Communication Technology'', located in.. :Room 601, FUQIANG Building, No 1-2 :Area 62, Mabu Community, Xixiang street :Baoan District, Shenzhen, ''China''
